name: Hotel 140

reviews.title: Good location but not a hotel ....
reviews.text: We picked this 'hotel' predominantly because of the price given that Boston hotels are notoriously expensive - not to say it was a cheap option.

reviews.title: Not a pleasant experience
reviews.text: Please be aware this place is not a hotel, it is part of the YWCA building that has been converted into for want of a better description nice ensuite dorm rooms. On our floor there were definitely people living in their rooms not just visiting.

reviews.title: The very basic Hotel 140
reviews.text: Saying that the place is very clean, if perhaps a little clinical in the corridors, it feels like a school or office block. There are no real guest facilities apart from a cafe down the stairs that is officially part of the YWCA.

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: Biggest pain - the bed a 'double' which was effectively a big single bed so it is a little cosy to say the least is travelling with your other half .. saying that the small bed was very comfortable.

reviews.title: Tiny but Inexpensive with Great Location
reviews.text: This is an ok place if you are after clean accommodation but the bed and lack of any real hotel service would put me off from going back.

reviews.title: dreadful choice
reviews.text: Tiny rooms, even smaller beds ( a mere double between two people) and absolutely no service. This is more a rooming house than a hotel. Avoid.

reviews.title: Value for money, good location
reviews.text: The hotel location is really good. It places in the middle of the town. It closes to everything especially subway. By the way, the room we rent was very small as other reviews said. Our room had one window which opened to the construction site. Then, the view was not that impressive. Also the shower area was even worse. It's small.

reviews.title: Ok Basic Hotel
reviews.text: Conversely, the hotel was renovated, so it is very new & clean. Staff was nice especially the aunty at the lobby. :-)

description: Hotel 140 is an affordable boutique hotel offering the best deals in the Back Bay. Our rooms are modern European in design, clean and cozy. Our recently renovated building, a historic landmark listed on the National Register of Historic Places, also houses a beautiful lobby, function rooms, and The Lyric Stage Theater Company. Hotel 140 is just steps from Copley Square in Downtown Boston's historic Back Bay neighborhood - recently voted "Top 10 Neighborhood in the Country" by the APA. The South End's hip restaurants and shops are close by, as are Newbury Street's high fashions and fabulous dining. We're close to the Financial District, Hynes Convention Center, and other business centers. Public transportation is right around the corner at Back Bay Station.
